model

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Action

  • public class Action
extends Object
    This class represents actions. Actions are either predicates to reason with or agents that create and delete fluents in the database.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus

    • Constructor Detail

      • Action

        public Action(SimpleSentence action,
      ArrayList<Initiator> initiators,
      ArrayList<Terminator> terminators,
      Goal conditions)
        Constructor of the class.
        Parameters:
        action - the SimpleSentence object that is the generic predicate representing the action.
        initiators - the ArrayList containing all the DPost declarations that initiates fluents.
        terminators - the ArrayList containing all the DPost declarations that terminates fluents.
        conditions - the preconditions that must be satisfied before performing the action.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets the name of the action. It is the name of the SimpleSentence predicate.
        Returns:
        the name of SimpleSentence representing the action.

      • getPredicate

        public SimpleSentence getPredicate()
        Gets the predicate representing the action. The predicate is represented as a SimpleSentence.
        Returns:
        the SimpleSentence object representing the action.

      • getInitiators

        public ArrayList<Initiator> getInitiators()
        Gets all the DPost declarations that initiates fluents. It is collected in an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList containing the initiators of the action.

      • getTerminators

        public ArrayList<Terminator> getTerminators()
        Gets all the DPost declarations that terminates fluents. It is collected in an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList containing the terminators of the action.

      • actionsAllowed

        public ArrayList<SimpleSentence> actionsAllowed(RuleSet rules)
                                         throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Checks if the action can be performed. If this needs bindings for the variables of the action, it will return every version of the action with its allowed binding.

        The method gets every solution for the conditions of the action and applies the bindings got to the generic SimpleSentence.

        Parameters:
        rules - on which the conditions will be tested to get solutions and bindings.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList that contains every version of the action. If there is no solution, it will be empty (but not null).
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException

      • fluentsToInitiate

        public ArrayList<SimpleSentence> fluentsToInitiate(SimpleSentence event)
                                            throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Gets all the fluents that will be initiated. It simply take all the initiators of the action, take every fluent they initiates and binds the fluents according to the event put in parameter.
        Parameters:
        event - the version of the action that is performed on the database.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of the bound fluents according to the parameter.
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException

      • fluentsToTerminate

        public ArrayList<SimpleSentence> fluentsToTerminate(SimpleSentence event)
                                             throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Gets all the fluents that will be terminated. It simply take all the terminators of the action, take every fluent they terminates and binds the fluents according to the event put in parameter.
        Parameters:
        event - the version of the action that is performed on the database.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of the bound fluents according to the parameter.
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return the action under the form of: "if (conditions) actionName=[[initiators], [terminators]]"
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
